criteria: Recognition of Numbers as Tens with Zero Ones
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate an understanding that two-digit numbers are composed of tens and ones.
Student shows limited understanding, struggling to differentiate between tens and ones in a two-digit number.
Student can identify tens and ones but struggles to explain their quantitative value within the number.
Student correctly identifies and explains the value of tens and ones in simple two-digit numbers.
Student demonstrates a solid understanding of tens and ones, accurately explaining their value and relationship in various two-digit numbers.
Student exhibits a comprehensive understanding of tens and ones, including their value in complex scenarios, and can apply this knowledge to solve related problems.
Student does not recognize numbers like 10, 20, 30...90 as a specific number of tens with zero ones.
Student has difficulty recognizing that numbers such as 10, 20, 30...90 represent a certain amount of tens.
Student recognizes numbers like 10, 20, 30...90 as tens but doesn't connect it to the concept of zero ones.
Student understands that numbers such as 10, 20, 30...90 are composed of a number of tens and zero ones.
Student clearly explains the concept that numbers like 10, 20, 30...90 are made of a specific amount of tens, with zero ones and can give example
Student demonstrates mastery by applying the concept of tens and zero ones to solve complex place value problems.
Student cannot apply place value understanding to solve any problems.
Student attempts to apply place value understanding but is largely unsuccessful.
Student can apply place value to solve very basic problems but struggles with more complex scenarios.
Student correctly applies place value understanding to solve most problems related to tens and ones.
Student consistently and accurately applies place value understanding to solve problems, with the ability to explain reasoning.
Student expertly applies place value understanding to solve complex problems and can explain the underlying mathematical principles effectively.
